element.name: Phoenix Park - NCR Gate & Lodge by Lahtac, Unknown Cache (1/1.5)
element.description: Dublin Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city. At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.
element.long-description:
There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same design.
The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is elevenkilometreslong and three metres high.
The wall also supports itsown particular flora.
The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.Bus Route(s): No's 10, 25, 37, 38,39, 66, 67 from city centre.
Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a gatekeepers lodge as part of the entrance cluster.
To find the cache which is a tabloc box wrapped in black cloth and requires extreme stealth you must first solve the following puzzle.
QUESTION 1. How many hectares make up The Phoenix Park ANSWER = ABC
QUESTION 2. How many acres does The Phoenix Park consist of? ANSWER = DEFG
QUESTION 3. How many lodges with living accomodation are there within The Phoenix Park? ANSWER = Hi
Question 4. The gate that leads into the lodge contains two words. How many letters are in the second word? ANSWER = J
NOW SOLVE THIS PUZZLE TO GET THE COORDINATES
N53.3*A.(i-J)F(D+H) W06.(B+C+E+H).(D+i){(C+H)-D}[B+D+G+H]

ul.li:
2010-06-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Got this evening...should have gone for it the other night...but thought it was private property...ah well..TFTC...

2010-06-16T20:05:41Z : Enable Listing by Lahtac
Checked and all looks good.

2010-06-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Joint FTF with Blue Jay 59. We were surprised that it had not be found before as it had been released a few days. We have now done all of the "Phoenix Park" series which were all very enjoyable. TFTC Toffee Man #367

2010-06-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Joint FTF with Toffee Man. Surprised this evening to see this one hadn't been found so we took a run into the Park. Picked up the last of the clues, did the maths, rooted around and viola! There was the cache. Co-ords jumping a bit with the tree, maybe 8mts off GZ. Less at times, with 2 sat navs got repeated different co-ords. We were approached by a resident of the nearby lodge, who was a bit worried that we might have a "stash" there, (not sure what to think about that - do we look like we might be "stashing" stuff [:)] ) Anyhow, as he seems to have seen several people around the place and was getting alarmed, at first we said we were on a treasure hunt, he thought Bloomsday & wanted to know our clue & help... now he knows about geocaching and is aware the cache is somewhere around and thinks that's "cool", He assured us the area is not "Private property", although the car park at the back is. Nice guy, if you see him or his girlfriend/wife watching from the upstairs window just wave [:)] TFTC & the series, makes for a nice walk around this lovely amenity, which we live quite close to and tend to take for granted. We have enjoyed the whole series. #365
This entry was edited by Blue Jay 59 on Thursday, 17 June 2010 at 03:24:56.

2010-06-16T07:42:31Z : Temporarily Disable Listing by Lahtac
Stewarts enquiry on this one. Let me check and revert.

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Phoenix Park - NCR Gate & Lodge
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Dublin Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city. At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same design.


The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is elevenkilometreslong and three metres high.


The wall also supports itsown particular flora.


The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.Bus Route(s): No's 10, 25, 37, 38,39, 66, 67 from city centre.


Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a gatekeepers lodge as part of the entrance cluster.



To find the cache which is a tabloc box wrapped in black cloth and requires extreme stealth you must first solve the following puzzle.


QUESTION 1. How many hectares make up The Phoenix Park ANSWER = ABC


QUESTION 2. How many acres does The Phoenix Park consist of? ANSWER = DEFG


QUESTION 3. How many lodges with living accomodation are there within The Phoenix Park? ANSWER = Hi


Question 4. The gate that leads into the lodge contains two words. How many letters are in the second word? ANSWER = J


NOW SOLVE THIS PUZZLE TO GET THE COORDINATES


N53.3*A.(i-J)F(D+H) W06.(B+C+E+H).(D+i){(C+H)-D}[B+D+G+H]
